title: Bazel does not honor `umask` anymore

labels.name: P1
labels.description: I'll work on this now. (Assignee required)

body:
### Description of the bug:


Up to version `7.0.0` directories of the cache had been created and permissions had been only pruned by `umask` like it is usually done by Unix/Linux SW.
This had changed with `7.0.0` with 4da06426be298a350260879852db651da389c6c8 (and probably related commits).

This interferes with the use case to share the disk as well as repository cache on a single machine by giving mutual write access to the folders using a dedicated group. This may not be the preferred approach, but is simple enough and used to work quite well. For instance:
* Configure `umask` to `0002`.
* Assign relevant users to a group `bazel-cache`.
* Create the toplevel cache directory and `chmod g+ws <dir>` and `chown :bazel-cache <dir>`.
* Configure `--disk_cache` and `--repository_cache` accordingly.


Quote of the commit message
> Making all directories group and world writable seems excessive;

Imho the user, system configuration or whatever decides if it is wanted â€“ Bazel ist not in charge for that.

Core
